row.Docu:
= Action name = PCK.AUTOMIC_DOCKER.PUB.ACTION.BUILD_IMAGE
= General description = This action is used to create Docker Image from a Dockerfile. User will provide the path to .tar file containing Dockerfile and 'Image name' along with optional 'tag' separated by : in the Image name input. Further this action builds the image as per the instructions defined in Dockerfile. Image name can be given as xyz:1.1 where xyz is the name of image/repository and tag is 1.1
= Inputs = * Server URL : Specify the host IP address or fully qualified domain name * Certificate Path : Certificate directory path. Specify only for secure URL (https) * Path to TAR file : Path to .tar file from which image will be build * Image Name and Tag : Name and Tag (optional) to be given for the resulting image * Advanced options : Provide options in comma separated format The following options could be provided in "advanced options" : dockerfile - path within the build context to the Dockerfile. This is ignored if remote is specified and points to an individual filename q - true/false, to suppress verbose build output nocache - true/false, do not use the cache when building the image pull - true/false, attempt to pull the image even if an older image exists locally rm - true/false, remove intermediate containers after a successful build (default behavior) forcerm - true/false, always remove intermediate containers (includes rm) memory - set memory limit for build memswap - Total memory (memory + swap), -1 to disable swap cpushares - CPU shares (relative weight) cpusetcpus - CPUs in which to allow execution, e.g., 0-3, 0,1
= Behavior = (see general description)
= Outputs = * Return code is 0 in case of success. * Return code is 1 in case of failure. * Return code is 2 in case of connection timed out !!
= Return Value =
= Rollback = (none)
= Logging = AE logs will be displayed in the AE report. Java logs will be created at \temp\docker.log under agent installation directory.
= Example = (none)
